alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated mostly light to locally heavy rainfall falling across northern portions of Dorchester, Colleton and Berkeley Counties. While the risk for additional flooding is diminishing, minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas is likely still ongoing in many areas this evening where as much as 2 to 3 inches of rain fell earlier. For this reason, the Flood Advisory has been extended until 8 PM EDT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moncks Corner, Saint George, Dorchester, Saint Stephen, Harleyville, Bonneau, Reevesville, Jamestown, Cross, Pinopolis, Eadytown, Bonneau Beach, Old Santee Canal State Park, Chicora, Moorefield, Cross Cross Roads and Murraysville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
